intro: Evax contracta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed evax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pale yellow, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are characterized by their narrow, contracted base, giving it its scientific name. Evax contracta is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats.
